file_content.text: You! Murderer!
Look around. These halls are filled with murderers.
Who, me?
You're the only murderer I have my sights set on.
Yes, I answer to that title.
Oh, you're a riot. But me and my boys, we're crowd control.
The lightsaber's a dead giveaway, isn't it?
More than murderer--Sith.
Hmm, the lightsaber's a dead giveaway, isn't it?
More than murderer--Sith.
So, you managed to survive the trials, did you? No doubt by backstabbing my father!
My father was a staunch traditionalist and he was especially hard on me. But he's my blood. Did you think you could kill him and get away with it?
Uh, refresh my memory. I kill many people's fathers.
Be more specific.
Refresh my memory. I kill many people's fathers.
Be more specific.
You seek to add insult to injury? I'm Eskella Gryton. My father was Overseer Tremel. Remember killing him?
The death of an insect isn't very memorable.
Why should I?
I would remember, if I'd actually killed him.
Your father is alive.
Do you deny it? Lord Baras has my father's hand.
Well, I don't know. But I am in possession of his ring, see?
Maybe. [Show Tremel's ring]
Stay out of my affairs.
My business is vengeance--which makes my father's murderer very much my business.
I wasn't worried about the consequences.
I didn't care.
Then you don't deny it. You killed him.
I won't deny killing you either.
I deny nothing.
I don't have to suffer such insolence!
I was ordered to kill Tremel.
Baras ordered his death.
That doesn't absolve you from responsibility.
How else would I have his ring? See?
Yes. [Show Tremel's ring]
I'm going to rip that ring from your steaming corpse!
I give it to you willingly, Eskella. Here.
You can have the ring.
Great. You think that's going to placate me?
I'm going to add your ring to the collection.
You'll die the same way.
Relax, Eskella, your father is alive.
He's not dead.
Who told you I killed your father?
Listening to rumors, Eskella?
Everybody says so. The whole place knows you killed him. And now you have to die.
Well, I suppose the whole place can't be wrong.
Everybody told you, hmm?
Don't think so.
Come at me and I will kill you, too.
Attack and you'll join him.
You'll rue the day you took his life. Attack!
Stand down, Eskella. Your father isn't dead.
Tremel lives.
That's a lie. Lord Baras has his hand.
Your father gave me his hand and left Korriban.
It was a trick.
What are you saying? That my father forfeited his hand so you wouldn't kill him? And now he's out there hiding, pretending to be dead?
I mercifully took your father's hand instead of his life.
But not his body.
What? You took pity on him and now he pretends to be dead?
Use your imagination, woman.
Don't be so dense.
Wait, are you saying that you spared my father's life? You took his hand and told Lord Baras that he's dead?
You may not be a murderer, but your mercy proves you're not Sith material either. I should inform Lord Baras, but I won't.
No, let him discover your softness for himself. My directive is clear now--I must hunt down my gutless father and end his humiliation.
You go ahead and do that.
If you must.
Leave him alone, Eskella. Let your father live in peace.
Spare him.
My father has shamed me. Destroying him is the only way to redeem my name.
I'll be sure to kiss him on the cheek for you. Come on, boys, let's go.
I'm not going to let you do that.
I don't think so.
Let me? Who do you think you are? My father has brought shame to me and our entire family. He must die.
Nevermind, I'm killing you anyway. Men!
Hmm, I think you want to speak with your overseer, youngster.
I'm busy with my father here. Please don't bother me.
